SENSEI.Definition: a teacher or instructor usually of Japanese martial arts (such as karate or judo)

NATURE.Definition: the type or main characteristic of something

BE ON THE LOOKOUT FOR.Definition: to watch or search for (something or someone) : be alert to

THUMBING THROUGH THE BOOK.Definition: to turn the pages of a book, magazine, or a document quickly and only read small parts of it

GUARANTEE.Definition: to engage for the existence, permanence, or nature of : undertake to do or secure

PASSAGES.Definition: a short piece of writing or music that is part of a larger piece of work

TECHNIQUE.Definition: a way of doing an activity that needs skill

WAG.Definition: (especially of a tail or finger) to move from side to side or up and down, especially quickly and repeatedly, or to cause this to happen

ALMOST JUMP OUT OF HIS SKIN.Definition: to say that someone is suddenly surprised or frightened very much by something

ULTERIOR.Definition: a secret purpose or reason for doing something

REAL ESTATE.Definition: property in the form of land or buildings

CANARY.Definition: a small, yellow bird that is well known for its singing, sometimes kept as a pet

LIGHT AND JOY.Definition: something or someone you love very much and who makes you happy

STEADFASTLY.Definition: staying the same for a long time and not changing quickly or unexpectedly

BUCK BRUSH.Definition: the common name for several species of North American shrubs that deer feed on

SHEER.Definition: used to emphasize how very great, important, or powerful a quality or feeling is; nothing except

ECSTASY.Definition: a state of extreme happiness, especially when feeling pleasure

CONSTANT.Definition: happening a lot or all the time

TRAGIC.Definition: very sad, often involving death and suffering

TRAGEDY.Definition: a very sad event or situation, esp. one involving death or suffering

DIVINE.Definition: connected with or like God or a god

INSTINCT.Definition: the way people or animals naturally react or behave, without having to think or learn about it

BLUNDER THROUGH.Definition: to move in an awkward way

WIGWAG.Definition: signal by waving an arm, flag, light, or other object

INJURY.Definition: an act that damages or hurts

ERUDITE.Definition: having or containing a lot of knowledge that is known by very few people

IDLE.Definition: an idle moment or period of time is one in which there is no work or activity

FIDDLERS.Definition: a person who plays the violin (= small, stringed instrument), esp. in music popular in rural areas

PURSUIT.Definition: an activity that you spend time doing, usually when you are not working

KEY.Definition: very important and having a lot of influence on people or things

IMMERSE.Definition: to become completely involved in something

WELL-KNOWN.Definition: known or recognized by many people

TWO-WAY STREET.Definition: a situation or relationship requiring give-and-take

WELFARE.Definition: help given, especially by the state or an organization, to people who need it, especially because they do not have enough money

WARD.Definition: one of the parts or large rooms into which a hospital is divided, usually with beds for patients

ORTHOPEDIC.Definition: relating to orthopedics (the medical specialty that deals with the treatment of bones that did not grow correctly or are damaged)

CONVALESCENCE.Definition: the process or period of resting in order to get better after an illness or operation

DESPAIR.Definition: the feeling that there is no hope and that you can do nothing to improve a difficult or worrying situation

WELLED UP.Definition: of a liquid or emotion, to fill up (a container or vessel) to the point of overflowing

BITTERLY.Definition: in a way that shows strong negative emotion such as anger or disappointment

TENDERNESS.Definition: the quality of being gentle, loving, or kind

BEARABLE.Definition: if an unpleasant situation is bearable, you can accept or deal with it

COMPLIMENTS.Definition: a remark that expresses approval, admiration, or respect

COUNTERINTUITIVE.Definition: something that is counterintuitive does not happen in the way you would expect it to

DEGRADE.Definition: to cause people to feel that they or other people have no value and do not have the respect or good opinion of others

NETWORK.Definition: people that you know, considered as a group whose members exchange information with each other

EMPATHY.Definition: the ability to share someone else's feelings or experiences by imagining what it would be like to be in that person's situation

CONQUER.Definition: to deal with or successfully fight against a problem or an unreasonable fear
